Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
             throws CommException
connect is used by a client to open a TCP/IP connection between a pair of applications with intentions not defined. This default implementation does nothing since protocols like HTTP are stateless, and do not require persistent connections. throws Ljjb.toolbox.net.CommException if a communication problem occurs.
Specified by:
connect in interface CommManagerIF
Throws:
Ljava.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported, or not implemented.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws CommException
disconnect closes any connection to a remote host. The default implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException since protocols like HTTP are stateless, and do not require persistent connections. throws Ljjb.toolbox.net.CommException if a communication problem occurs.
Specified by:
disconnect in interface CommManagerIF
Throws:
Ljava.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported, or not implemented.

listen

public boolean listen(int port)
               throws CommException
listen sets this communication manager up as a server listening on a specified port for client's request to connect.
Specified by:
listen in interface CommManagerIF
Parameters:
port - an integer specifying the port number in which to listen for client connections.
Returns:
boolean to indicate a succesful connection. throws Ljjb.toolbox.net.CommException if a communication problem occurs.
Throws:
Ljava.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported, or not implemented.

listen

public boolean listen(int port,
                      int timeout)
               throws CommException
The overloaded listen method sets this communication manager up as a server listening on a specified port for client's request to connect and does so for only a specified amount of time.
Specified by:
listen in interface CommManagerIF
Parameters:
port - an integer specifying the port number in which to listen for client connections.
timeout - an integer specifying the number of milliseconds to time out the server's wait to listen for connections.
Returns:
boolean to indicate a succesful connection. throws Ljava.lang.CommException throws Ljjb.toolbox.net.CommException if a communication problem occurs.
Throws:
Ljava.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported, or not implemented.

receive

public java.lang.Object receive()
                         throws CommException
receive is called in an asychronous form of communication to receive Serializable objects from the remote object over the established connection.

receive in interface CommManagerIF
